page.title: 02FARMING AROUND LLANDYSUL
page.content: The average farm is about 100 acres. Most of the land is pasture for dairy cattle. The main crops are silage, hay and corn used for winter feed for the animals. Some farmers keep small numbers of sheep and beef cattle. Tankers collect the milk for the Milk Marketing Board. Farmers receive 60p a gallon. The recent E.E.C. milk Quota has affected the dairy farmers because now they can only produce a certain number of gallons for which they will be paid. Many farmers are having to reduce their herds or move into different kinds of farming. The main dairy breed is the Freisian cow. Every cow produces an average of five to six gallons daily. A veterinary group practice in the village serves the farming area and beyond, and a large livestock market is held in the village every other Tuesday.
